description:
The story is set in Meiro-chou, a town where all-female diviners (uranaishi) live and where girls from all over the country yearn to become the top diviner — "Urara." Today, a solitary girl named Chiya enters the town's gates. However, she has another purpose coming here, besides becoming the Urara. Chiya's days as an apprentice diviner begin as she meets three friends — the earnest Kon, Koume who is a fan of Western culture, and the shy Nono.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

name.native: マリ・キスピルクエット

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YooheySuzuki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鈴木洋平_(アニメ演出家))

Youhei Suzuki is a director and former director of photography formerly working for [J.C.Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/JC-Staff). Currently freelance.

Not to be confused with the producer of the same name Youhei Suzuki (鈴木洋平).

[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大塚舞)

Originating from [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/). Currently freelance.

Aspired to become an animator after having seen [Densetsu no Yuusha Da Garn](https://anilist.co/anime/2803/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/松倉友二)

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/) since 1992, where he currently serves as the Executive Officer and General Manager of Production Headquarters. Also the representative director of Jam Creation.
Yoshio Ookouchi is a composite artist affiliated with A-1 Pictures.
